run.data dirpath comment: Directory path to folder containing desired hdf5 files and input.dat
run.unit walltime comment: Runtime of a single multigrid cycle of this dataset on a single core of Intel Xeon. Used to estimate job scheduling walltime.
run.num nodes comment: Iterable: Node counts to run at
run.num tasks per node comment: Iterable: Number of MPI tasks to execute on each node
run.num threads per task comment: Iterable: Number of OpenMP threads to assign to each MPI tasks (count includes the master thread/task)
run.num repeats comment: Number of runs at each distinct job configuration
run.mg cycles comment: Number of multigrid cycles to perform.
run.partitioners comment: Iterable: Which partitioners to use over. Supported are 'parmetis', 'ptscotch', 'inertial'
run.validate solution comment: Toggle whether to compare final grid state against a precomputed solution. Check STDOUT for pass/fail status.
run.final comment: Regarding list options, the Python job generator iterates over the cartesian product of them. For more info see main 'for loop' at line 177 of gen_job.py

compile.compiler comment: Which compiler to use. Supported are 'intel', 'gnu', 'clang', 'pgi', 'xl'
compile.cpp wrapper comment: If target system requires use of a wrapper around compiler (eg Archer), state that here
compile.general parallelism comment: If possible, enabled modes below will be combined; if not, gen_job.py will complain

setup.jobs dir comment: Directory path to folder containing created jobs.
setup.job scheduler comment: Specify job scheduler. Supported are 'slurm', 'moab', 'lsf', 'pbs'. Alternatively, set as empty string '' for local execution.
setup.partition comment: Specify which job queue to target
setup.project code comment: Specify which project code to use
